Description: Two fragments of tapestry band, hemmed, applied and sewn to a plain weave ground; a) 4.5x15cm, b) 4.5x9.8cm; tapestry is decorated with a stylized human head with green hair and surrounded by red, yellow and green geometric and heart-shaped motifs on a beige background; at top and bottom are two lines of dark blue wool; balanced plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/10-13), weft-undyed linen (S/10-13); sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply) in running stitches; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S/grouped by 2-3/7), weft-undyed linen (S/36), dark blue, red, green, yellow wool (S/yellow is 48); two edges are hemmed and sewn and the others cut and ragged; oversewing in undyed linen (S spun Z ply); two fragments join
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
